title: Polynomials and the FFT
content:
Chapter 30

Polynomials and the FFT

VII: Selected Topics

Chapter 30: Polynomials and the FFT

Fast Fourier Transform - O(n log n) polynomial multiplication

Key Points

  • Polynomial multiplication: O(nÂ²) naively
  • FFT: O(n log n) via divide-and-conquer
  • DFT: evaluates polynomial at roots of unity
  • Inverse FFT: interpolate back to coefficients

Real-World Applications

Signal processing, audio, image compression
